_header: If no love is O God what feel I so
_description: ‘Song of Troyelus’ — five stanzas rhyme royal, extracted from 5248, Book I. 400-34.

Banna.First Lines:
Gif no luve is o God quhat feill I soAnd gif luve is quhat thing
                    and quhiche is he…
Banna.Last Lines:
…in to hir hand and with hummill cheirBecoim hir man as to my
                    lady deir

HunEL26A13.First Lines:
If no love is o lord what fele I soAnd if love is what thing and
                    what is he…
HunEL26A13.Last Lines:
…þat from it comþe may to me savoury thenkeFor ay
                    thirst I þe more þat I it drynke
HunEL26A13.Note:
Fragment: Book I, lines 400-406 only; see also 5248 ‘A
                    whetstone…’.
